The sports setting makes it easy to get great shots of fast moving sports.  I have 2 other pocket sized Nikon cameras and have received excellent customer service.  I have found that their warranty is much better than some other brands. I'm a real Nikon fan.

Reviews.Title: The best camara ever
Reviews.Author: dot
Reviews.Content: The clearest pictures and the fastest shutter button for a digital. I swear it could be an slr. There is not a viewfinder, which dissapointed me, but the quality and the speed I can take pictures surpasses that. I almost did not get it for that reason, This is the best camera I have ever owned!

Reviews.Title: Loving it
Reviews.Author: M. Beck
Reviews.Content: Love it so far.  Bought this model a couple of months ago specifically for the "sports" photography features.  I wanted good on-field soccer pictures, without spending a ton of money.  The zoom is GREAT!  Love the 20 second back to back shots feature also - great for capturing that perfect slo-mo shot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MMO Fan
Reviews.Content: This is the first high optical zoom digital I've owned.  It does take a little bit to learn all the features, as this little camera is pretty packed with different options.The only true drawback I can find with this camera is the issue of only 3mp pictures at 3200 and 6400 ISO.The video and audio are both surprising good for a camera.  I've previously had a couple of Fuji cameras, and they came nowhere close to a comparable video quality.I have yet to use the panaorama maker, but from the examples they provide, I'm looking forward to some great pictures this fall.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: CFS
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this purchase. The camera has many features, I love the sharp, and crisp quality of the pictures. I am able to get very close shots and the color and detail are amazing....

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: tetra
Reviews.Content: This camera is recommended by Consumer Reports and has so many good reviews on Amazon. I have tried for over a year to get the hang of this camera, but it's hit or miss at best on any setting. The easy auto setting is mostly a disaster. I've had some luck with the backlight setting in night scenes. I just have missed so many pictures (blurriness or terrible color in the picture) that it's maddening. I almost never took a blurry picture with two lower priced Canon cameras that I owned previous to this. Now I'm surprised when I don't take a blurry picture.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad camera, but a bad EBay camera
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Well, people certainly seem to love this camera.  I don't.  In fairness, it has many nice features which other reviewers have commented on.  The lens is unbelievable and getting 15x physical zoom on a camera this price is incredible, plus the image stabilization is very good and you can get clear shots without a tripod even at 15X.  The macro mode is very good although it occasionally gets confused with focusing and you can't get all the way in to the much-ballyhooed .4", but still, superb closeups are quite possible.  There are many other nice features that other reviewers have commented upon.  As other reviewers have pointed out, the performance of this camera in low-light conditions stinks.  I would say if you shoot primarily outdoors, you should seriously consider this camera.Unfortunately, I don't.  I bought this camera primarily to shoot indoor pictures for eBay and a good macro mode was mandatory.  Unfortunately, pretty much any indoor picture qualifies for "low-light" unless you use the flash, which I don't because on this or any camera it gives pictures a very cold color balance.  My big, big complaint is that when you snap a shot, the colors of the picture you take come out differently than it looks on the screen.  This makes it impossible to decide what settings to use prior to taking the shot.  Trying to get the right colors on a picture becomes a matter of trial and error.  You shoot a picture, then you look at it, it's not right, you try a different setting, and go through the process all over again.  It's an arduous process if you have a still subject and are trying to achieve a certain look.  I find the built-in modes to be confusing and it's unclear what effect they will really have on the final picture, so once you start playing around with the modes, you are again back in the trial and error situation.  I wanted a camera that would take good pictures without much effort, and for the situation I am in, this is NOT the camera.  Outdoors where there's plenty of light and the zoom will be a lifesaver, it's a great camera.  But indoors, my wife has an Olympus Stylus that shoots reliably great pictures the first time with little effort (and it has an incredible macro mode too).  I'm sorry I got this camera.  It seems nice but for me it was ultimately disappointing and a huge time-waster.***** UPDATE *****Well, several months later and I have gotten quite good at finagling good pictures out of this camera indoors.  The white-balance function is the most important.  For indoor pictures, the "fluorescent" and "incandescent" modes seem quite effective in generating realistic colors under the appropriate light sources.  I generally have to avoid the "auto" white-balance because it often changes its mind about what the appropriate white-balance is from one picture to the next, and it can cause consecutive pictures of the same subject to come out differently. On some occasions when none of the built-in white-balance modes seem to work right, the "auto" sometimes seems to do the trick, so I do use it a little.The other thing that helps a lot is the exposure function.  Apparently they figured out that this was a crucial function people would have to mess with a lot to get good pictures out of their camera, so they gave it its own control directly on the back panel. I shoot a lot of pictures against a black background, and the subject consistently comes out overexposed unless I reduce the exposure significantly.So, basically I've learned to fiddle with the white balance and the exposure every time I shoot pictures for an auction, because different subjects often require different settings.  I stay away from "smart auto" mode because it's not so smart as they wish it was.  And I do get some great pictures out of the thing now.  It wasn't worth the hundred hours of headbanging, hairpulling, reading the manual, and experimenting at great length, to get to this point.  So for shooting outdoors, buy this camera.  Otherwise, avoid.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L110
Reviews.Author: Willow
Reviews.Content: Nice point and shoot camera for the value. I have also used the newer model L120 which has higher zoom power and some handy features. But I am pretty satisfy with the 15X zoom on L110.Picture quality is wonderful. Easy to use - push buttom instant movie mood. Clear picture. Not like the flat body cameras, it is a bit bulky to carry.

Reviews.Title: Good value for under 2 hundred
Reviews.Author: Cloxter
Reviews.Content: First I should say I am a dinosaur, but this camera isn't at all hard to learn to use. The auto focus is a little bit tricky in wildlife photography, so read the parts on focus lock and such. The trick is to zoom in first and then trip the auto focus. Pics are superb with a wide difference between the 15X optical zoom and the 3X digital zoom. Seems to keep the pic from pixelating with the digital zoom only 3 power. Shoots beautiful sunsets and all. Overall an excellent choice for the person who wants a point-and-shoot but some flexibility to fine tune the shot. One more thing--a point and shoot is MUCH better off with a big body,Nicer processor, and a BIG LENS. Overall, I'm very happy. Don't fool around with the commercial camera cases. Harbor freight sells aluminum cases that work fine (make your own interior), and offer better protection for your camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this camera! It takes amazing pictures. I have no problem getting great shots of my kids, who are constantly in motion. This camera is a big leap above a basic point and shoot, take time to read the manual and understand how to use it well. After reading about it, I am taking wonderful photos! The batteries that came with it lasted long enough to take 1045 pictures, and some HD videos as well! I recommend this camera to anyone who is ready for a step above a point and shoot, but not quite ready for a DSLR

Reviews.Title: Amazing Zoom!
Reviews.Author: Aphelila
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for our cruise to Alaska for one reason: the zoom. The zoom is everything I could ask for. You can zoom all the way in, click, and you have a perfect picture-on auto. No blurriness whatsoever without a tripod. I've never had a camera that could do that. I've also taken quick action shots of my dog running up a hill, no blurriness. The modes are easy to use and a lot of fun, especially portrait mode for some cute close-up shots. For a casual photographer who just wants some easy, beautiful shots, this is the perfect camera. Don't expect it to have the same options a manual camera will have. It's the perfect Nikon for a beginner who wants a camera with a great lens that's very user friendly. Battery life IS short, but it takes AA batteries which is AWESOME. I bought three sets of rechargeable batteries-they're much cheaper than buying a replacement battery for a camera that doesn't take regular batteries. Run out of rechargeable batteries and you don't have your charger with you? You can buy a set of AA for cheap anywhere and you're saved. Haven't used the video feature yet, but I have seen some videos others have made with it and the quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L110 - Good for Bloggers
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Ngan
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nikon L110 camera at the end of December so I can use it to enjoy festivities with my family AND to replace my old Canon SD400 point and shoot camera. I have been very satisfied with it and used it many times for pictures.In terms of ease of use with navigation, the Nikon L110 is extremely easy to use and the option mode has enough features to let you explore different types of finishes (auto, black and white, portrait, etc). Once you get used to the Nikon options screen, it will be very easy to navigate through the features. I give it a 10/10 for navigation ease.As for the features of the camera, it is a bit above your traditional point and shoot because of the zoom lens. Beside looking like a DSLR camera, the fundamentals of the L110 is similiar to a traditonal point and shoot, but with better quality. I recommend reading the manual and blogs to get the most out of this camera because you can execute great quality images if you play around with the ISO speeds. I do a lot of macro shots since I'm a blogger and with the right lighting, your pictures will look great. It would be nice to change the aperture speeds, but I don't believe you can. I give the features a definite 8/10.I have not tested the video feature yet, but I do remember that it makes a humming noise when you reply. I'm not sure if this is because the camera is so sensitive, it captures air (crazy, right?) or it's just how it is. I wasn't too crazy about the battery part. It just seems kind of cheap to not have a charger pack for it, but over time I can see how convenient it can be if you ever need to replace them.In terms of value, it is an amazing value for what you get. I originally bought this camera for $199 on sale at Staples, and I bought the "bundle" that went with it (camera bag, mini tripod, insurance for $40) and a memory card for $5 (2 gig), and I felt like I had all that I needed to have and it was a great investment for me because I can take quality pictures without having to splurge on a DSLR camera, especially since blogging is merely a hobby.Overall, this is nice lightweight camera that is portable and very easy to use. It stems above a tradtional point and shoot but picture quality is in the same range if you're not careful. It does tend to blur if you're not using flash, so it's best to have a steady hand when using. I really do like this camera a lot, and I'm still on the experimenting stage with it as I use this camera to capture objects in different lighting, surroundings, etc.Overall: 9/10If you want to look at pictures, head to my blog to check to them out.[...]All images after Jan 2011 were captured with the Nikon L110.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: I wanted a reasonably priced camera with at least a 15x zoom and this camera fits the bill.  Takes wonderful pictures with a little manipulation of the settings.  I'm used to a point-and-shoot camera (my Canon died after 8 years) where I didn't have to change the settings to get a great picture.  After a couple weeks of trial-and-error with the settings, I have taken wonderful pictures.  Some reviews complain of the blurring in the pictures- yes, I had that also.  I made a couple setting changes and no more blurring.  I just took it to a basketball game and didn't get one blurry picture of all the action.  I would highly recommend this camera for someone looking for a nice camera at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot and Beyond
Reviews.Author: AJ Samuel "Reasonable critic"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for Christmas for our son who has shown some interest in photography.  We didn't want to go full blown DLSR, but we wanted to something a bit beyond a traditional point and shoot.  He has already taken some stellar wildlife photos along with a couple great shots of the family dog.  The optical zoom is unbelievable.  The camera isn't going to fit in your pocket like a digital elf, but that isn't what it was designed for.  On the other hand, it is perhaps only a third of the size of a DLSR, so it has a fair amount of portability.  The 3 inch screen is great for reviewing shots on the camera.  You can see the screen quite well in bright light.The camera has a ton of features that will allow him to experiment with more advanced photo techniques as he grows into them, yet it is taking brilliant pictures right out of the box.  We couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: BAD Images! Not Stable! No Viewfinder! Not Nikon Quality!
Reviews.Author: H. B. Estabrooks Jr.
Reviews.Content: I thought it was just me but it wasn't.  After owning this camera for several months (and taking 100s of pics.), I went back and looked at the reviews.  In particular, I read the >20 1-star reviews.  Yep!  Lots of people have problems with the image quality and the stabilizing feature (NOT HELPED BY THE ABSENCE OF A VIEWFINDER!).It's wierd.  If you zoom in on the image of any photo, even those taken on the highest quality Image Mode setting, everything is fuzzy.  Nothing is sharp.  Image edges, and details, look like they have been painted with pastels.  I have much-cheaper cameras that produce much better images.This camera is a waste of money.  Either buy a cheap point-and-shoot, or buy an SLR.

Reviews.Title: I like it, but----------------------
Reviews.Author: Ansel
Reviews.Content: ......you do have to be smarter than the camera as it is not exactly a point and shoot....It has a host of likable features that someone with old photo experience will appreciate, as well as a host of imaging modes....If its not outdoors in bright lights, you will likely have to change settings to maximize the odds of your getting the pic, and you will definite need to follow the fundamental rules of low-light photography; those whining about blurred pics clearly are not smarter than the camera. I'm getting some really nice/pleasing pics with it in non-point & shoot lighting conditions, particularly with the 1600ASA.Its light weight, I love the 15x optical zoom. I get a good run on NiMh bats, but I shoot mostly at 5mp, I've turned all the sounds off except for the shutter, and turn it off after every pic.Mine has been on a mutli-night hike to the bottom of the Grand Canyon, and to the summit of Longs Peak, with pics that stop folks in their tracks, in all lighting conditions from the dark of an alpine night, to moon light, to noon desert.If you're looking for a no-brainer point & shoot, and you are not up on the basic rules of sharp picture, not in sync with getting mentally & physically in tune with snagging a pic, this isn't the camera for you. Though, it does point & shoot like a champ in the correct point & shoot conditions.Like I said, I like it, a lot, but as an old 35SLR guy from the days when they didn't have internal light metering systems, I am smarter than both the L110 and the conditions in which I like to take pics. This was a no brainer for meAs the prices come down, I'll likely be picking a couple more L110s up for the out years as the technology rapidly moves on. But then, I'm still packing a couple Olympus C-2100s and C-750s as I really like them too.

Reviews.Title: Seller is not good
Reviews.Author: Subbu
Reviews.Content: I returned the item to the seller unopened and they sent an email saying that they deducted 10% of the amount for restocking which was not the correct reason.  When called over phone, they told me that 10% of the amount for shipping charge which was so high and I feel that the seller over exaggerated the amount. If you order and give shipping charges, for the delivery after 5 days, the charge is around $8 only whereas, this seller Electronic Express charged $22 (approx.).  Better to avoid Electronic Express, though the product is a good one.

Reviews.Title: Slightly better than average
Reviews.Author: J. Demond "Frell you"
Reviews.Content: Having only owned two super zoom cameras including this Nikon, I have to say my lowly Kodak Z712is camera is the better of the two. That's a three year difference in technology.The Kodak offered full manual control, and an electronic viewfinder.This Nikon doesn't offer either. What it does offer is controls best suited to a simpleton. I don't always want my camera to automatically pick it's shooting mode.I want to be the one that does that. Knowing what I know now about this camera, I probably would have went with a like sized Canon.There are some good points though.12mp is a huge plus nowadays.3" screen with anti reflective coating is a huge plus.Decent optics.15X zoom while not close to some of the more expensive cameras is more than adequate for your average shooter.Battery life is great with Lithium batteries.The camera is fast to come on, fast to take the shot once locked on, and fast to store.Pictures are good provided you know how to take a photo.Low light pictures can be captured using the auto mode and upping the ISO.You will have grainy shots of course, but you can then lock on to distant objects with just 1 ambient table lamp on.The bad points.No manual control.Slow to lock onto a subject.Speed shots are limited to 3mpEasy mode doesn't know what's it's doing half the time.Manual flip up flash...Even the Kodak's flash popped up automatically when needed.

Reviews.Title: Nice cam, but no manual control and video is not great
Reviews.Author: thotha
Reviews.Content: The camera is ok, comes with a really good Nikkor lens, and takes great pictures. However, people expecting some manual controls will be disappointed. The zoom is extremely good, but when in maximum zoom the clarity is not reflected on the screen. That's fine really because this gives great picutures when viewed on the computer. The camera is a little bulky, so don't expect it to fit into your pocket. Its not as huge as a DSLR though. It comes with a strap, 4AA batteries, a USB cord, a lens cap and a CD having nikon software. The only thing is it doesnt have a viewfinder. I thought it would, but it doesnt. For the price, you cant ask for better. Its ideal for taking good picutures without having something bad like a 3x zoom. The 15x zoom is great. However the only bad thing is video. Zooming on video is a big problem, and it comes out blur. Other than that, its great, has lots of features, though none are manual. Quality of pictures shouldnt be a concern. The quality is really great. The flash is awesome too. As I said, the only minus is the video capability. Otherwise a great cam :)

Reviews.Title: A Real Nikon Deal
Reviews.Author: Lovepelic
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a new camera and had seen this one used by someone in my family.  Really wanted one but felt I couldn't afford it.  It was suggested I look on Amazon so I did and was able to get it for $100 less than I had seen it in stores!  I ordered it and had my new camera in less than a week.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I love the camera I t takes such good pictures. It takes far away pictures very good nice and close up.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: We really like the camers.  Wish it had come with a view finder.  But not a problem.  Takes really good pictures.  The lithium batteries that came with the camera only lasted for about 14 pictures then died.  Really satisfied with purchase..

Reviews.Title: Use Portrait Setting :)
Reviews.Author: joneskl
Reviews.Content: We got this camera to take pictures and shoot video of our 4 young (under 6) children and the one on the say.  Read some of the reviews that all picture came out blurry, and was concerned.  After some trial and error, realized that the portrait setting takes care of this issue and picture come out clear as a bell 99% of the time.  You can also use the sport setting which captures continuous frames and then go back and pick the best one.  Love the vidoe feature all wrapped up in a pretty portable camera.  We got the 16GB card with the reader insert so we could upload them easily into IPhoto.  We also picked up a small Nikon case on ebay for $9.00 to help keep it safe when we are out and about, so on a whole it was a great value and will be great for our family!

Reviews.Title: A great little camera.
Reviews.Author: William Brennan "wreckingball34"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix L110 is a great little camera for people who are nervous about buying one of those "confusing" and expensive DSLR's.  It takes fabulous pictures and at 12.1 megapixels, you can enlarge your photos to just about any size. The 15X zoom is nifty as well. The macro feature works pretty well, but you have to get pretty close for the autofocus to work. That can make shooting insects difficult (but not impossible though). There are many shooting modes like Sport, Landscape, Smart Portrait, and....you get the idea. The only mode that is missing is Manual mode, which may be a major con to some, but the only complaint I have is that you can't take time lapse shots due to lack of ability to change the shutter speed manually. I use my old camera for that. Oh well. For $200 I won't let that sour me to this camera (my old camera actually cost more). A minor con is that the flash doesn't flip up by itself when needed. The camera tells you to raise it, but I've found that it's just easier to raise it from the beginning. It just takes getting used to. No big deal. The last minor con is that the 3" LCD screen automatically shuts down after only 20 seconds or so and takes a few seconds to come back up when you hit a button. I missed a few shots due to that in the beginning, but I just started pressing the shutter button half way down periodically so I don't miss as many opportunities. There is no eyepiece or viewfinder on this camera either. You point and shoot through the LCD screen. I was worried about that, but I find that it hasn't effected my pictures at all. The screen is bright and clear. I found the neck strap to be limiting considering that you'll want the camera off your neck due to the point and shoot nature of it. I ditched it and spent ten bucks on a DSLR wrist strap. It's soooo much easier. I can't comment on the video feature because I haven't used it and have no intention of using it. I have a camcorder for that. LOL. The battery life is FANTASTIC! I use Energizer Ultimate lithiums (it takes 4) and I've shot over 800 shots and just got my first battery warning today. No complaints there. I recommend this camera highly if you're looking for a cheaper camera that still takes great pictures. I hope this review is helpful to most of you. I know I'm no scholar. I'll try to include some of my pictures if I can.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jemez Red
Reviews.Content: I received my camera just two days prior to my 3 week vacation to the NorthWest and Durango, CO.  I did not have time to properly learn about all the features, but I am very happy with the camera and everyone who sees it is impressed.  I took over 300 pictures of scenery and family, and was amazed at the quality.  Very comparable to my son's camera which cost over $400.  It is bulky in size compared to many other cameras, but that is just the shape I wanted.  It is easier to grasp, point and shoot.  I highly recommend this Nikon Coolpix L110.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpx L110 Review
Reviews.Author: Steven R. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Easy to use and takes great pictures. I highly recommend it along with a larger flash memory card by Transcend. That way you can take great video as well.

Reviews.Title: Incredible zoom
Reviews.Author: Boom
Reviews.Content: Incredible zoom!  Upgraded from point and shoot Canon. Camera is light and looks good. Easy to use menus, still having trouble with low light pics and movement when taking a shot.  Still have to play with camera a bit, overall a good beginers camera.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jeremy N. Carter "jncarter5"
Reviews.Content: We just got back from two weeks in Hawaii and took over 2300 pictures there with this camera.  You definately need to read some of the manual which explains all of the settings.  While you can get ok pictures just pointing and shooting, you will be much hapier by selecting the correct settings.  The zoom is fantastic and allowed for some really amazing shots.  Another really cool feature my wife fell in love with is the sports mode.  While you do sacrifice quality for quantity it will help insure you don't miss that perfect shot.  In sports mode the photos are 3MP instead of the usual 12 but they rapid fire at a rate depending on the speed you press the shutter release.  We are very pleased with the camera.  The only thing I would love to see is a waterproof housing...

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Minnick "Photograph Master"
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to get into photography and wow, this was a breakthrough into that world.clean pictures, and great effects,along with tremendous zoom, make this camera my all time favorite purchase on amazon!

Reviews.Title: Best so Far
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best camera I've owned so far.  Granted, I haven't owned very many, and all of them have been small digital cameras under $150.  This one tops them all so far.  The picture quality is excellent and the video quality is good too.  I'm not a professional by any means, but this camera more than does the jobs I need it to.

Reviews.Title: Skip this one!
Reviews.Author: Amy in DC "ajdoherty"
Reviews.Content: I am an avid scrapbooker, so clear and sharp photos are paramount to me.  I bought this camera specifically for the sports continous function, so I could catch multiple pictures of my quick moving toddler without waiting for the camera to "reset" between shots.  Photos taken in sports continous mode, even with a high speed memory card, are UNUSABLE. They are chalky with vertical white lines throughout the picture.Using other modes, it is extremely difficult to get a sharp photo.  Most photos are blurry and the flash takes a long time to warm up and then reset.I resort to using my old cheap-o point and shoot when I need great pictures like at Christmas.Total and complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera purchase I've ever made
Reviews.Author: Julie A. Felton "tekiechick"
Reviews.Content: I used this camera once while on vacation.  The second time I tried to use it, which was about a month later, I got a "Batteries Exhausted" message.  I replaced the batteries numerous times with no luck.  Now, it doesn't even TRY to turn on.There were so many things that I loved about this camera - mostly the AMAZING pictures it took (for about a week), the wide angle, and the incredible zoom.  But this is all useless if the piece of junk won't turn on.  This camera has gone from a 4.5 star purchase to a 0 star purchase in less than a month.  I'm still waiting for tech support to get back to me with a resolution...

Reviews.Title: cool coolpix
Reviews.Author: K. dillon "clear in Colorado"
Reviews.Content: not the kind of camera you just pick up and shoot but has alot of features and once you learn it a good deal for the money. very lightweight

Reviews.Title: not up to expectations
Reviews.Author: SkateMomFL
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera primarily for the Continuous Sport mode, since my son is an avid skateboarder.  The first set of photos I took came out fairly clear, but with an odd 'outline' around him (outdoors, dusk ~ 6pm).  I adjusted a few settings, and the next set came out well (outdoors, ~ 4pm, slightly cloudy).  At this point, I was pretty happy with the camera - I thought the number of images per second was very impressive, and I was pleased with the amount of shots that were taken.Unfortunately, things went downhill from there... Indoor birthday party photos (set to indoor mode, with and without flash) came out with an orange tone.  The next 2 sets of Sports Mode images were taken at indoor skateparks, and all of the images came out streaky.  After reviewing the manual, I realized I would only be able to use this mode in very limited situations.  Nikon recommends NOT using sports mode in basically any environment where you would watch or play sports -- bright sunlight, under bright indoor lights, under fluorescent lights, etc.  I suppose you need to be outdoors between 2-4pm, with the sun behind you, and with slight cloud cover to avoid any sort of glare. And forget about taking photos after the sun goes down - those were grainy and blurry.I'm extremely disappointed that this didn't work out.  I loved the size of it, and the shiny red body really made it stand out.  I was hoping this would be a good transition camera before entering the world of SLRs, but, unfortunately it didn't meet my needs.  I'm sending it back tomorrow morning.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: V. Olsen
Reviews.Content: Pros:  nice zoom, easy to use, comfortable to hold, long battery life with the lithium batteries, great LCD displayCons:  although easy to use, there are numerous menus and different ways to access them depending on whether you are in picture taking mode or view mode.  Takes some getting used to!Time delay between taking pictures too long.  The manual flash, a pain to remember to open when you are in a hurry to take a picture.No automatic orientation option to automatically rotate any pictures taken (when holding camera sideways to take pictures lengh-wise).  Must manually, picture by picture, rotate each one so that it appears appropriately in a slide show mode or picture viewing mode on camera or PC.  This is very inconvenient.Biggest con of all:  Picture quality is not great.  My 7 year old, outdated Kodak Z740 takes better quality pictures.  I experimented with all the auto settings, manual settings, etc. and rarely was able to get a crisp picture.  Photos look adequate on LCD, but when actually downloaded or printed - not vivid at all.  Not at all what I expected and hoped for when I decided to upgrade my camera.

Reviews.Title: sport mode sux
Reviews.Author: Azure Ayres
Reviews.Content: sport mode has lines that go up and down the picture. inside pictures are horrible. takes too long to focus and miss shots. but for digital macro and outdoor non moving objects it is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: What am I doing wrong?
Reviews.Author: M. Lee
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 2 years.  I am not happy with it.  I have gone to classes on using different camera settings for different effects to no avail.  All my indoor photos come out yellowish regardless of what mode it is in.

Reviews.Title: Love my Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: D. Baron "Rover"
Reviews.Content: Love the ability of over ridding the settings. The videos are outstanding from this camera.  I was pleasantly surprised.  My only hangup is that the flash is not automatic.  You must remember to lift the flash housing.  It does take some time to learn all the features of the camera but I now have had this for 24 months and I am still very happy.Nikon Coolpix L110 12.1MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Kewl cool pix
Reviews.Author: Mountaineer62
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement camera for a Fuji that "died" after 8 yrs of use.  With the exception of a through-the-lens viewer, the camera satisfies my point and shoot for family photos; not certain it will meet my need for action photos.  But, I have other cameras to meet this requirement. Little difficult to see images on the back screen in high light (sun) conditions.  Quite happy with the purchase and the price.

Reviews.Title: Happy lil photographer
Reviews.Author: Christie
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son who loves taking photos. Bday present. Its awesome. He loves. Great pictures. And good learning tool for him.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Xxkarax3
Reviews.Content: Amazing quality product for such a good price. Takes phenomenal pictures. I love this camera and wouldn't trade it. So many features and options and the zoom is incredible.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAM
Reviews.Author: MIKE JONES
Reviews.Content: AWESOME CAMERA. TAKES GREAT PICS. COULDNT FIND IT AT THE LOCAL STORES SO I BOUGHT THIS ON AMAZON.COM ... IF YOU LIKE SPORTING EVENTS IT HAS A SPORTING MODE THAT TAKES 8 PICS WITH ONE PUSH OF THE BUTTON TO GET THAT PERFECT SHOT.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for us!
Reviews.Author: Jenjen
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for almost a year now.  We bought it a month before our son was born.  We wanted something that could take pictures of our baby quickly, without having to wait 5 min. for it to take the picture.  This camera takes very fast pictures.  It has great settings.  I love the close-up setting and have taken many awesome pics of flowers, leaves, bugs, etc.  It has a great zoom.  It doesn't get all blurry when you zoom in like a lot of other cameras do.  The only thing I don't like about this camera is that it is bulky and kind of heavy.  It no longer fits in my purse anymore.  I guess most of the bulk is from the 4 AA batteries that are used.  So, even though it is bulky, I like the fact that if the batteries die, they can be easily replaced instead of having to plug in and charge the battery.  This camera loads pics onto our Apple computer very well.  Overall we have loved this camera.  If you are looking for something that takes great, fast pics, and has an excellent zoom, this is the camera for you!

Reviews.Title: NOT TOTALLY SOLD ON THIS CAMERA YET
Reviews.Author: lovetakingpictures
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for about 6 months now and have very mixed feelings about it.  The zoom on it is amazing and I have captured some awesome shots of wildlife, etc. I have also taken some beautiful close-up photos of flowers, etc. that are just gorgeous.  The thing that I am really having a lot of problems with are just the basic photos of everyday life when inside the house, etc.  I take a lot of photos of my family, friends, animals, etc. and  sometimes they turn out good, others times not so much.  They seem to turn out better during the day, rather than at night when lights are turned on inside the house.  Then they seem to look grainy and somewhat blurry.  What was a real disappointment was this past week-end when I left my little point and shoot camera at home and decided to take pics with this only because everyone always asks why I don't use it more for get togethers, etc.  I took it to my grandson's 1st birthday party which was held indoors and I am very disappointed in the way the pics turned out, wish I had taken my other camera for back-up.  The pics came out blurry and grainy and I missed some great shots because of trying to figure out why it wasn't working like I think it should have.  And forget asking someone to take pics for you if you want to be in the pic, they won't be used to it enough to know that your hands can't move at all or you'll have a blurry pic.  My father has the same exact camera and his is always attached to the tripod for this reason, he can't get clear pics without it.  One other little gripe I have with this camera was mentioned by someone else who reviewed this, to view photos you have to take the lens cap off, otherwise it will pop off.  I am now trying to find a point and shoot digital camera to purchase so that I will have a decent one to use when my granddaughter arrives in a week.  Like I mentioned before the zoom is great and it does have the capacity to take wonderful pics, but you really have to become accustomed to it so you know how to hold it, etc.  I was very impressed with the sport mode on this camera, it takes great action shots, one right after the other when you hold the button down. And I feel it is a great camera for the money. But, if you want a camera that you can just grab and shoot though, go with a compact digital.

Reviews.Title: Good hybrid camera
Reviews.Author: sandyT
Reviews.Content: This is a nice looking middle of the line product. Its pretty easy to use. Zoom is of nice range. A couple of issues I have with this camera. It requires pretty good illumination fot it to take bright pictures. If the room is a little dark, the LCD starts grainy and pictures comes out less bright (yellowish) Flash is manually operated which is a hassle if you in a time senstive moment. Video quality is decent. Although not at par with other HD recorders. Even smartphone's HD video quality is better than this camera. Overall, although not a junk, Could have been better. Lot of room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat detailed review.
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: I think this camera was a great camera for the price i bought it for. Everyone i showed it to was very impressed and said it looked very professional. Its easy to get around the menus and settings, the zoom is in a nice place, it zooms well getting good shots but you have to have a fairly steady hand or i would suggest buying a tripod because this camera is not so forgiving in that aspect. When you are viewing a picture of something shiny like jewelry (or the sun), that has a bit of glare it has these lines of rainbow color vertical on the viewing screen. When you take the photo and are looking at it no lines are visible, the picture looks perfect. There is no view finder like the older style cameras have, which i would have liked.I like the variety of photo settings, there are the usual like landscape, sport, portrait but they added some unexpected ones like food and panorama assist for a panoramic view of say a wide sunset. Overall i really like this camera but i would also suggest buying a memory card since the camera only holds 16 pictures at a time.

Reviews.Title: BUENA CAMARA!!
Reviews.Author: Dahomey Romero
Reviews.Content: esta camara es facil de usar, las funciones son las que realmente se utilizan, en cuanto a las imagenes son muy nitidas. y las calidad de los videos es excelente HD

Reviews.Title: OK, but, not great
Reviews.Author: Artrina
Reviews.Content: I was on a cruise and my Canon camera stopped working. I bought this camera on the ship as I wanted a camera with a P&S; with a decent zoom and one that took AA batteries. I'm happy with the pictures I took that didn't use the zoom or when I used the zoom and had a way to really steady the camera - my tripod I feel saved the pictures I took while cruising in Glacier National Park. The biggest downfall for the camera is the poor image stabilization (I hope I worded that correctly!) Many of the pix I took when I was standing still across a room show evidence of shaking. I don't see a problem with the pix I took in low light that other reviewers seem to see - the ones I did were cleared up using the photo problem on my computer. I thought about keeping this camera if my Canon wasn't repairable and decided that because of the shaking issues I would not.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Alexandria L. Griffith "alexandria lillian"
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera since December, and I love it.It has tons of settings for any lighting/motion situation. The sports setting works great for capturing motion in good lighting, but in darker settings the photos do come out looking a little grainy. Great setting for capturing photos of kids playing and sports events. The zoom is great! It comes with a handy neck strap which attaches to the lens cap, which keeps the camera safe from dropping. It's also great for shaky hands. I'm very pleased with the purchase.I suggest it to anyone looking for a mid-range camera for multiple purposes.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy for a mid-range camera
Reviews.Author: Will Gee "Bill"
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased to replace an older model Canon.  Much research had been done among the top brands.  This has been an excellent purchase decision.  The zoom range is adequate for most shots, especially among cameras of similiar price.  The previous Canon has been a good camera but nothing close to this one as to features and quality of photos.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L110
Reviews.Author: R. Pittrof "Big Bob"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, just about all the things that you need or would like to have on this type of camera except they forgot to put a view finder on it. If you want to take pictures in the open sun light areas you can't see a thing in the LCD monitor, you just point it in the direction that you want and hope you get what you want, or stand in the shade or indoors, maybe carry a dark cloth to put over your head and the camera, no wait, that is what George Eastman did in the early 1900. I would give this camera a 9 out of 10 rating, because of no view finder.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Adan
Reviews.Content: Esta camara destinada a un usuario domestico pero quisquilloso como es Excelente, en calidad de la imagen como en el diseno de la camara. Recomiendo este producto.

Reviews.Title: Nothing negative so far
Reviews.Author: JA
Reviews.Content: Since I am not a big camera guru, my review probably means little.  But my wife and I wanted a camera that had a better zoom.  After doing a lot of research into cameras using Consumer Report, this camera had some of the best ratings among its competition.  It was right at $200, and so far, we love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Deputy Dog
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I have had it for a few weeks now so I have a good understanding of its functions.  I use this camera for several different things.  I am a deputy sheriff and use this camera for basic crime scene pictures.  I am also the web page administrator for the local FOP (Faternal Order of Police), and use this camera for all pictures for the site.  It has worked very well for both functions.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Starla
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera!! Easy to use, takes awsome pictures! Has so many great settings on it to get that perfect picture! It is a little akward to carry, but I like to carry mine in my purse. Over all its the best camera for the money. Its a good price on Amason. At Best Buy they were wanting some where around $220. I got this camera on Amazon for $187! Over all this is an amazing camera!!

Reviews.Title: You can't go wrong for the price!
Reviews.Author: Miguel G.
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to capture my kids' activities and take vacation pictures.  I was looking for a good size digital camera that will shoot good quality pictures as well as withstand the rigors of parental handling.  I'm glad to say that the L110 did not disappoint.  The "scene" selection feature took the guesswork out of the mix.  I actually have fun finding the best setting for indoor, outdoor and different weather and environmental situations.The weight and size of this camera helps me keep my shots steady.  The size of the base helps when it comes to using the timer.  I can easy place it on an even surface and run.  This is something I can't accomplish quickly with the small, dainty digital cameras.  The size of the LCD, lens and bulk also lends itself to a tripod.The best surprise for me was the quality of the video and sound I get from the L110.  I'm a professional TV producer and have used my share of highend broadcast cameras.  Let's just say I'm picky when it comes to video.  Again, for the price I paid, the video yield is excellent.  I just shot a video of my child's concert last night under indoor gym lights and it came out great.  The plus was the sound.  I really wish this camera had an audio output for a headset and a mic input.  But that's asking too much for the price.Of couse, it's not perfect.  The only gripe I have is the placement of the SD card slot in the battery compartment at the base.  It becomes a little cumbersome to remove and insert an SD card. But this is not a deal-breaker for me.  If you're a parent who wants a run-and-shoot digital camera, you can't go wrong with the L110.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L110 Review
Reviews.Author: Rose Carrosquilla
Reviews.Content: I've been doing research on digital cameras for the past few weeks trying to decide which is the best for the money I was willing to spend.  I currently have a Canon A510 compact which I've had for about 5 years.  Its a great little camera but with only a 3X zoom and 3.2 MP, I felt as if I was missing out on some great pictures. To be honest, I'm not a professional photographer but I like taking vacation photos and lots of pictures and little videos of my grandchildren.After doing some research, I narrowed my search down to the Nikon L110 and the Canon SX130IS.  I really liked the Nikon L110 mainly because of the 15X zoom and 12.1 MP. About 2 weeks ago, I purchased the red Nikon L110 but returned it back to the store when I realized that someone had owned the camera before I did because all the settings were already in place and the batteries were missing.  I initially wanted to exchange it for one that hadn't been used but there were none left so I just got a refund.Today I went into Costco and much to my surprise, they were selling the L110 with a 4GB SD card and a camera case for very low price of $159.99 so I bought it again.  After setting it up I took some shots and they came out pretty good.  I even took some video which came out OK too.I am very happy with this camera because I realized that I could read camera reviews from now till eternity and will always read something bad about each and every one.  I decided to buy a camera that was in my price range that had the features I was looking for.  The Nikon L110 fits the bill perfectly.  Its a great looking point and shoot camera, is very responsive, and it's simple to operate.The only thing that I can fault on this camera is that you can definitely hear the clicking sound when you are zooming in and out while shooting video.  Since I have a separate compact video camera, this was not a deal breaker. Overall, this is a nice little camera for the price with some really good features.

Reviews.Title: Love it so far!!!
Reviews.Author: CandiHope
Reviews.Content: Well, i had a Canon powershot sd 1400is and LOVED it, best little camera i have ever had.. but unfortunately it got stolen afew days ago and i have been so upset...my husband knew that i had been researching this camera the Nikon L110 and had ordered for my birthday whice is in April,but he gave it to me early since i was camera-less now. i'm not a photographer and don't plan to be i just love taking pictures of our 20 month old daughter, so this is what the nikon was going to be for and special events,the mountains, vactions (we are going to Hawii for Christmas) and things like that and use my Canon for when we went out with friends, bonfires, lake... things like that. BUT now that the canon is gone this is all have so i'm glad that it's not huge, but it's still fancy and takes amazing pictures, i think. The zoom is so good i can't wait to take some pictures at sunset and of the moon. anyways i just got it today my husband surprised me with it. I went right outside to test it on our dog and get some shots of our daugther, neither of them would stay still of course so i just messed around with the settings and figured they probably wouldn't turn out all that good the first time but i was wrong they turned out great, i zoomed in and took one of our dog running at me and it's so cute not even blury, i'm very happy with this little camera it's great! :)

Reviews.Title: Missed the mark for me
Reviews.Author: MuxDux
Reviews.Content: I read the manual from front to back and took several hundred pictures with this camera over the weekend. The burst mode is quite good, something like 10 shots a second at low resolution. It seems like I barely dented the battery capacity with the included lithium AAs. Those were definitely pluses.However, 95% of the photos were noticeably blurry, even without any zoom, on the AUTO and EASY AUTO presets. I adjusted the ISO and "scene" settings and got an unacceptably small level of improvement, along with considerable degradation in image quality.Subjects sitting down five feet from the camera came out inexplicably blurred, looking like they were about to make the leap to hyperspace, even with a flash. These were shots I thought were the simplest possible. Now perhaps there is some arcane tweak to the L110 settings I could have made to improve the results, but I tried.In the more demanding zoomed pictures, I expected some blur, and got it. My reaction was a big fat MEH. Perhaps with more practice those shots could be improved. But here's the tradeoff: a tiny Canon pocket point-and-shoot already works fine for 80% of the pictures I want to take. It would have aced my weekend shots, except for those involving big zoom, or burst mode. I don't see the point of owning a larger camera which is so finicky or ill-suited for basic shots when something smaller and simpler does the job better. And the successful zoom shots from the L110 were not that great anyway.Overall, I was underwhelmed. This L110 missed the mark and I sent it back (easily through Amazon). For about $20 more I'm buying a Panasonic Lumix model a year or two old but that gets consistently rave reviews. (Unfortunately Amazon was materially underbid on this transaction.)

Reviews.Title: Nikon lover
Reviews.Author: DanielSan
Reviews.Content: I love the camera! It has a great appearance and has wonderful quality for both videos and pictures. Awesomely Amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice little magic camera
Reviews.Author: Felipe Navarro
Reviews.Content: The L110 is just great! If you are a professional you will be disappointed; but if you aren't and wish to improve your photographer skills, then this is the one for you!! Takes a while to figure out all the options but they really help to get the pictures you want once you know how to use them... and the money you will pay for it is ridiculous!! BUY IT, BUY IT, BUY IT!!

Reviews.Title: Clarity, Detail of photos
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: Built solid, the L110 is very worth the price. The flashbar must be manually raised, a mixed blessing, taking time to start shooting, yet, for novices, the lack of an auto-pop-up flashbar means that the automatic mechanism won't be broken, by accidentally holding it down, when it wants to pop-up. Also, the lens cap must be removed before powering on, since the lens extends right away, right out to about an inch from the lens cap ring.The Clarity and detail are very noticable. In highest resolution mode, a class 10 SD memory can get 20 frames in one second. I expected to be held back to a lower resolution mode, for this shot mode. I haven't tried sport-continuous, as stated in the features, resolution has to be lowered, for that shot mode.I just like the way it l00ks. Red is great. Deep red colour, and a metallic glossy deep red at that. The Camera has the air of an expensive one, and flair, point and shoot nature, and with the Nikor lens and optics, I've gotten some pictures I've been unable to get with other cameras.I remember other cameras I've had, that I allowed a friend to use, to shoot something, and upon telling them to please not touch the lens, that's exactly what they seem to do, by human nature, so the L110 is my baby, not to be used by anyone else, barring another afficionado to photography.

Reviews.Title: Very nice!
Reviews.Author: Carmen A.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas, and she's enjoying it a lot. She has taken many pictures, and the quality is wonderful. The resolution is clear, and the shutter speed is twice as fast as her last camera. The zoom is amazing, as is the video. She's thrilled to finally have a camera with super zoom, HD video, a bigger LCD display, and a great sports mode for action shots. Not the best camera for portability, but certainly worth its weight in wonderful photography.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Edwin S. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: Just as I thought, this camera is amazing. All it took was reading the  simple instructions on how to use it. The pic quaility and video are wonderful , best money ever spent.Two thumbs up.................

Reviews.Title: Reliable mid sized camera
Reviews.Author: Vinod
Reviews.Content: Easy to start, takes snaps quick in succession, easy file transfers to computer, amazing battery life.Lens cleaning is a routine requirement due to the big sized lens. Neck strap is a must to carry this.Usually needs tripod for low light settings in easy auto mode.Some times one is not sure if flash is working in this mode but mostly pictures are good. When flash does not fire, one might expect blurry snaps and moving objects trailing, better to retake, it is pretty fast for retakes.I tried using other modes and finally settled to easy auto with good lighting as my choice. sports continuous is also pretty good but small sized images.I am a mild user so I need more practice to fully understand this camera's capabilities. But sure it is a good one.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: lm
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon d60 and wanted a macro lense for it. They are fairly expensive, so when I got an email on this camera decided on it instead. Love it! The macro feature is great and it is small enough to carry on my horse. Picture quality is fantastic and it is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: RScales
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy this through Amazon, so sharing the price wouldn't be fair at all. What I will share is how totally pleased I am with this. We just upgraded from a 12MP fujifilm point and shoot which did well, but was a really basic camera. This camera is in a whole different league and I love using it every chance I get. The image quality is top notch, it takes awesome video, it can take quick shots continuously (based upon the SD card you have and rather it's a SDHC or not) and it feels good in your hands. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Still
Reviews.Author: Gerald A. Vanslambrouck
Reviews.Content: I have been using a Nikon, Coolpix S7c for the last four years with much success. The Nikon Coolpix L110 is a great improvement. Although larger it is easier to hold, has great features like manual pop-up flash, lens cover and operates on AA batteries. It operates similar to the S7c so there was very little getting up to speed time required.REVIEW UPDATE: I've been using the L110 camera for almost a year now and like it even more!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Review
Reviews.Author: gdearl
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is a very good camera.  The only thing I have found that is questionable about it is the speed between shutters and the quality of the picture when using the zoom is pretty poor.  Other than those two things it is an extremely good camera.  It is a good value for the money it costs.

Reviews.Title: much better options for the money
Reviews.Author: MN guy
Reviews.Content: First off Nikon makes some excellent camera's this is just not one of them. This camera feels great in the hand and has a great if not industry leading LCD screen on the back. I purchased this camera to replace a 5 year old Canon powershot S2 IS and returned it 3 days later due to terrible picture quality. The image stabilization and low light picture quality is some of the worst I've seen. I would say save your money and buy a better camera but you could spend less money and get a better camera. I truly don't understand the glowing reviews this camera is receiving.

Reviews.Title: Fuji or Nikon?
Reviews.Author: ato "none"
Reviews.Content: This camera was on sale at Wal-Mart for $199 for their Black Friday sale. After reading the reviews between the Fuji and the Nikon I was dead set on having the Nikon for the price and features. This camera is just amazing! A little more work with understanding the tech manual and I should be shooting great, no outstanding pictures very soon. If you are in the market for a upgrade camera with lots of features, easy to use and rugged , you have found your camera. Go buy this camera! at $196.99 on Amazon  for Black or Red is the best way to go.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: This camera took wonderful pics. The only downsize is the weight and size.I was really used to a point n shoot camera, so this is a bit larger and heavier. I wouldn't trade it for one though. The zoom is amazing! Pic quality far and close up is the best I've seen. Great camera for the money. Highly recommend to my friends!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading reviews on this site and seeing a close up shot of the moon. However, my experience was not what I expected. I spent a week reviewing the manual and taking practice shot before I went on a once in a lifetime trip. The quality of the photos were no better than ones I have taken with a $99 camera. The video playback contained a green vertical line that distorted the image. I just returned the camera and will purchase a less expensive model

Reviews.Title: No big complaints
Reviews.Author: L. Ross
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera now for about 6 months, using it mostly outdoors for nature videos.  My only complaint is that the video must be converted from MOV to AVI format before editing it in Windows Movie Maker.  Of course, a more expensive editing program (WMM is a free download) might have a converter built in.  But, that's my picture next to 'cheap' in your Funk 'n Wagnals.  The motion stabilization gizmos are great.  I routinely take video from my kayak, and the images are quite stable.  I wouldn't mind a lens cap built in somehow, but that's minor.  I like it.  The Nikon L22 (I had an L20) would be handy for sticking in your pocket, and it downloads into AVI.  But, I like the 110 just fine.

Reviews.Title: Hey there - smile
Reviews.Author: Leah D. Ash
Reviews.Content: My daughter bought this camera a few months ago.  I so enjoyed using it that I bought one for myself.  Can take some great sports shots if the lighting is pretty good.Easy to operate.  Many different settings - haven't been able to try them all out yet.  Not too big but substantial enough that I don't feel like my hands get in the way when I'm taking pictures.  I'm going to have fun with this camera in Paris!

Reviews.Title: Top Shelf Camera
Reviews.Author: SassaFrasGranny
Reviews.Content: The camera and company are top shelf quality.  My kodak fell in the river, I needed a new camera.  I tried different models on display at the stores.  Decided on this camera.  The company is equal to the great camera quality.  I will certainly need to read the manual or attend a class to learn of all great features.

Reviews.Title: a good camera for non-experts
Reviews.Author: X. Yu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my father-in-law. He likes it very much. It is easy to use, especially for non-experts like my father-in-law. Including both camera and camcorder in a single machine is a plus for people demand portability. The video quality is OK, better than my previously owned camcorder with standard definition (320p), but is inferior to those with higher definition(e.g., 1080p). But it is sufficient for us. My only concern is the photo quality. It seems to me the color of photos is bias to either yellow or blue. I re-set the white balance several times but do not improve much.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: E. Byrer
Reviews.Content: Not only is this camera beautiful itself, but it takes beautiful pictures and video.  My old camera was a Canon, so I'm still getting used to the Nikon interface to be able to use it to its fullest potential.  The lens is big and the zoom is fantastic.  It records HD video in stereo sound which is a great feature.  I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Alan Neville "Al"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a present for my "Tech-Retarded" mother. Within 20 min of having it out of the package she was taking stunning pictures, and videos. Very easy to use, I'm confident a drunk monkey could take great pictures with this thing.

Reviews.Title: coolpix L110 review
Reviews.Author: jsd
Reviews.Content: This maybe too complex a camera for a complete novice that I am.  I'm still learning how to use this but have many-many shots that seem to have incorrect lighting and/or are somewhat out of focus

Reviews.Title: THUMBS UP!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A AWESOME PRODUCT FOR AN AWESOME PRICE. I COULDNT IMAGINE ANY BETER. THE NIKON L110 IS EASY USE ANYONE CAN DO IT.AND THE FLASH WORKS EXCELLANT REALLY.AND I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO ANYONE WANTING A LOW VERSION OF PHOTGRAPGHY.LIKE ME I CANT AFFORD 5 AND 600.00 CAMERAS. SO THIS I BOUGHT FOR 189 ON SALE FOR BLK FRIDAY BUT YOU STILL CANT BEAT THE ORGINIAL PRICE EITHER. IF I HAD TO GET ANOTHER I GET THIS ONE AGAIN. FOR SURE?

Reviews.Title: A useful and good value for money
Reviews.Author: Amazon_fan
Reviews.Content: used for one week, really good to use. Not too difficult to operate. focus too good even when with bare hands without tripod. HD video good and easy to view on television and laptop. need to have the SDHC adapter to upload on the laptop as the connector cable speed is low. but if you get 8 GB card then really good. Overall a good price for a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money...
Reviews.Author: 3boydragons
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for family use 2 weeks ago.  I have no real interest in making videos or becoming a professional photographer.  I can not get a picture that is not blurry on this camera.  My tech swavvy nephew declared it the worst camera ever.  The steady cam mode does not work.  You can not take real close ups, 6", of anything, it blurs out.  If you try to take it off auto to manually adjust in a vain attempt to fix these issues it won't take an instant picture; and it doesn't fix the blurry from breathing, yes I said just breathing, issue.  Even setting the camera on something to completely steady it does not take a still pic ON THE STEADY CAM MODE!!!  This is an expensive camera that does not deliver.  Don't waste your money...

Reviews.Title: Not bad, not great...still on the fence.
Reviews.Author: Luis A. Rolando
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of homework before making this purchase, and my main issue is something that some have indicated before: On AUTO mode the camera will use flash when it doesn't need to or will not use it when it does.  Sometimes it will overexpose the picture because apparently it needs some time to process the lighting conditions before "deciding" what to do with the flash.  It's odd, and makes you have to do a little more work on your own to get the picture right.  Also, what's up with having to pop up the flash manually?  What a dumb idea! Once you pick it up and shoot a picture you're half expecting the flash to just pop up or just go off....but no, you have to do it yourself.  I had a Konica Minolta Dimage Z20 before this and I think that one was so much more user friendly.All in all, it takes good pictures and videos, obviously, don't forget to buy at least an 8gb memory card.  But I tell you what, for this price I believe there are cheaper cameras that can take pictures at least as good as these.

Reviews.Title: Bad product, bad company, horrific customer service
Reviews.Author: Ellen Urbani, author of "When I Was Elena...
Reviews.Content: Camera would go black for no reason. We contacted seller to return, and were given a return authorization number to use within 14 days with a return lablel they said would be emailed. It never was. I called back and was told, again, it would be emailed. It never was. Still getting the run-around, while being stuck with disfunctional camera.

Reviews.Title: Takes some getting used to
Reviews.Author: KT
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, once you're able to figure out how to us it. It is not user friendly, and the quality of the pictures seem to be blurry unless you can figure out how to set it to the proper setting. "Auto" setting doesn't seem to work like it should.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: SR-71
Reviews.Content: I was severely disappointed with Nikon on this one. If you enjoy taking any kind of motion shots, videos, or plan on using the continuous mode expecting a picture without lines all over it, this will be a waste of money. Spend the extra coin and get a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ35 12.1MP Digital Camera with 18x POWER Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD.

Reviews.Title: nikon very dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: lately nikon sucksall the images come out like yellowish (sorry my english) i did not had 1 pic i like of 300 pictures.its bulky, feels cheap, also all the pics are blurry.i have say some of the cheap kokas easy share are better than this one.i sold it in my bussiness and we trying out a panasonic zs5 still dont like. but its much better than this one.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L110 Excellant Camera
Reviews.Author: Devin D. Edwards "Claims"
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best camera I have ever had. I have had 35MM camera's in the past but nothing compares with digital. With a 4 gig card I can take over 600 pix and that is at the highest quality setting.  The anti vibration/movement feature works great, and the menu is easy to use. All pictures are sharp and at a perfect exposure.  I am very happy with this camera. I have not tried the video feature yet.

Reviews.Title: Great over all camera
Reviews.Author: Diomar Ferreira
Reviews.Content: Over all, I am very pleased; great portability and photo quality, but I am a little disappointed with the clarity of long range shots.

Reviews.Title: VIEW WINDOW
Reviews.Author: J. HARRY FREY
Reviews.Content: U CANNOT SEE TLHE SUBJECT IN VIEW WINDOW IN BRIGHT LIGHT. A POP UP SHADE FOR THE WINDOW WOULD BE PERFECT.  I HAD TO PURCHASE ONE FROM DELKIN  TTL 20.00. 0OTHERWISE IM HAPPY WITH THE PRODUCT.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel-Edinburg, Tx
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my wife a month ago and she loves it.  You can't beat this camera for the price.  It takes great pictures. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: order as described
Reviews.Author: Chula86
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera awhile ago, and have had no issues with this.  I bought this because I recently had a baby and trying to get those quick pictures with my phone just wasn't working.  This camera is very easy to use and I am glad I bought it. And thank you for the note in the box too :)  I have definitely enjoyed having this camera.  Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: CoolPix Camera
Reviews.Author: SecurityGirl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter's Christmas present because we used them for the National Park I worked at.  She LOVES it! it's an awesome camera with beautiful pictures and great settings.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work long
Reviews.Author: Lauren Engram
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and it last 1 year before it had issues. The flash had a defect and when I contacted NIkon they said it would cost more than the camera is worth to have it repaired! So, it was a waste of my money!

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera for the enthusiastic
Reviews.Author: Richie
Reviews.Content: Want to get serious about photography but with an quality camera without spending the big bucks just yet? Look no further. Takes great pictures, easy handling with more stuff than the average cameras and you will not want to sell it when you finally get your big interchangeable lenses camera. This will be your all around+vacations camera even after you get your pro camera.

Reviews.Title: ahaha really
Reviews.Author: A.
Reviews.Content: I do not like it at all. I thought it was just me. Now after looking up the reviews I see it is not. Everything they say about action and low light is true.

Reviews.Title: WASN'T PLEASED, RETURNED IT FOR CREDIT
Reviews.Author: Scorpio Sun 46
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon Coolpix 5700 in 2004. I still own it and it is still taking beautiful photos. I did want to buy a new Nikon Coolpix camera, and liked the body style. I received this camera and shot a few pics on "point and shoot" setting. I was incredibly disappointed. The photos were fuzzy, just flat poor quality. I do not know if this particular camera was a fluke of some kind. I returned it immediately. It was a fraction of the cost of my original Coolpix 5700. I am inclined to believe "you get what you pay for" in life.

Reviews.Title: Liked my camera!
Reviews.Author: ronald "Ohhhhhhhhhh"
Reviews.Content: The camera came in a box that didn`t weight anything. I said i got ripped off. Then i opened the box and it was full of sticky foam peanuts. I got angrier! Dumped all the foam and found something in plastic wrapped. It was the camera.The camera doesn`t weight anything.IT NEEDS 4 batteries. Nowhere on reviews that I read or description says 4 batteries. Even with the batteries is lightweight.Not a hard camera to use.Good zoom. It has a little lag like 1 or 2 seconds to do everything. If you can figure it out it will not be that big of a deal!Ditched my old Aiptek 5MP Digital camera for this one.

Reviews.Title: Love this acmera
Reviews.Author: Yoji
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera, the only negative will be the batteries size - I would prefer only one battery. Otherwise is fine. the camera takes good close-up pictures, self adjusts for good lighting and it is easy to carry around. recommend!

Reviews.Title: It's a nice camera-
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: A good product with good picture quality.  They say hindsight is always 20/20, and given what I know now, I would have bought the upgraded L120 instead.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Sj Fred
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and travel with, great photos and ability to post to the web or laptop, highly recommended too!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Shaunna514 "-Shaunna"
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Nikon L110 that I have owned. I obviously love it because I keep coming back. The close up option is my favorite because I can get such amazing pictures with a very inexpensive camera. :) The only down side is the flash. The flash on my first 2 L110's went out and that is why I purchased the others.

Reviews.Title: High Quality
Reviews.Author: rdearrieta
Reviews.Content: Its been years since I purchased this camera and yet I am still happily snapping digit high quality photos and videos.

Reviews.Title: Flash burned out after 18 months
Reviews.Author: Powderwake
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, but I have 3 kids to take plenty of pictures of and I did really like this camera for the 18 months that it worked.  Then the flash bulb burned out and Nikon does not sell the part to replace it.  Now I am looking at either taking it to a repair shop or mailing it back to Nikon, probably at a cost that rivals more than the camera is worth.  I will not purchase another Nikon product if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, good in low light, but it's slow
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Entity
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of years now. It's a very good camera, and has survived several tumbles down rocky terrain. It has a lot of features, a very good 45x digital zoom, and it takes nice, sharp photos. It does a really great job in low light. Sometimes it overcompensates and the pictures still come out overexposed, but other than that, it's great.Complaints:* It is slow to recover after taking a photo with the flash. If seconds count, give up. My Canon Powershot never had this problem.* Flash photos drain the batteries really fast. You can take maybe 10 flash photos before the camera shuts down.* It's a bit slow recovering from any shot. Really frustrating for photographing small children or wildlife or anything that moves around a lot. Use the "sport continuous" setting if you photograph moving objects often.* Mine has a tendency to "freeze up", and I haven't figured out why. Lately I've noticed that it happens after I've taken several photos in quick succession with the zoom in use, especially if I've got the zoom all the way out. The camera just stops responding, and eventually shuts down. It can't be reactivated unless you open the battery compartment, take the batteries out, and put them back in again. Sometimes the camera gets really hot, but not always. If it does, you need to cool off the camera and the batteries. It also happens when the flash card is more than 3/4 full. I can get 750 shots out of my 4gb card, then the camera complains that it has no memory and shuts down. Not usually a problem, except when I'm on vacation and don't have access to a computer to download my photos to.* My pictures often come out overexposed. I've got to reset the exposure level almost all the time, or spend time correcting it with photo editing tools.* The color red usually comes out slightly blurry, or the red object looks fake.* Without a tripod, it's very hard to take a good shot with the zoom all the way out.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Denis Carvalho Parry
Reviews.Content: I got it many years ago, but only now I have noticed that I hadn't written a review on it yet. Great camera and after these years still  taking fantastic pctures.

Reviews.Title: Card in Camera not Nikon Accepted
Reviews.Author: pcarriesmith
Reviews.Content: I love the camera.  However, the Transcend brand memory card that came with the camera malfunctioned while I was on vacation in British Columbia.  The batteries died while transferring photos from camera to computer.  I lost 15 irreplacable photos plus the memory card is now marked "cannot be used".  Nikon informs me that the Transcend brand memory card is not approved by Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Robert V. Drake
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of the name on it. After using it and "losing" most of my vacation pictures I have to say this is the worst camera ever owned. The menu system is archaic, picture quality is only average at best.Most images appear pixilated and out of focus. DONT buy this POS ! I'm going back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: love this camera!
Reviews.Author: kristen
Reviews.Content: i ordered this camera back in october, and it is so easy to use! it's a nice point and shoot camera with slr qualities. i got my camera "used - like new" for only $92! so i have zero complaints! if my memory serves me, i believe it arrived on time. i remember it was packaged well, bubble wrap all over the camera, undamaged. i use this camera almost every single day. i love the manual flash, i love the macro setting, the zoom is wonderful, and the shake reduction is especially great.

Reviews.Title: Really disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: I have a friend who has this exact camera. We compared notes and found that neither of us likes this camera. I am about to sell mine at a yard sale. The pictures, especially those taken at a distance are fuzzy. Even the special uses, flowers, portraits, are not satisfactory. The picture quality is terrible, not sharp, unclear, fuzzy edges. I am really disappointed in this camera. I thought with the name Nikon I could not go wrong, but this is not a good camera. I bought a $50 point and shoot camera for my son and it takes excellent pictures. I will invest in one of those.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures just recommend thatYou buy alkaline batteries they last long and are greatThank for you time!!

Reviews.Title: Poor functioning
Reviews.Author: David "Tack"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife a little over two years ago.  We both have used it and do not like it at all.  Don't even think you can take action photos of your grandkids with it! We can't seem to get the settings to match the same scene.  I'm fed up with it. Worst camera I've ever had. I'm disappointed in Nikon on this one. Mine still looks brand new and I'm ready to trade it for a Sony camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Abby Joan
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom and she loves it!  Its so much nicer than her old one.  She has used it so much and the pics come out fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera!
Reviews.Author: William R. Agustin
Reviews.Content: I was using a Sony DSC-H5 for my work as a home photographer.  The Nikon Coolpix L110 was a perfect replacement for the Sony.  The picture between flashes was really quick compared to the Sony.  I'm using rechargeable AA batteries in it and I was able to take a lot of pictures (roughly about 600 some with the flash) before I had to replace the batteries.I'm glad I switched over to Nikon.  I was aware of the brand since I already own a D3100 but I wanted something more compact and lightweight.  Plus I really didn't want to use my DSLR on the job site.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Carole B
Reviews.Content: Shipped fast, came in a camera bag! My 13 year old son bought this because he wanted to start getting into photography. I was a little nervous because I didn't want him to waste his money but it was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Heather N. Lord
Reviews.Content: I have never had an easier camera to operate, plus it takes amazing pictures! You can just figure out the super easy stuff to do or get into things like the panoramic pictures you can take with this camera. Either way, you will be happy!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Alex
